Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. Centered on his friendship with a thief called Musashi, the film takes place at the beginning of the Showa period when Japan was undergoing rapid change from tradition to modernization.

This movie is nothing short of a dark, gritty masterpiece. I may be bias, as the Apartheid era is an area I've always felt for South Africa. The problems they have are immense due to this time in history and while many people flourish now, there is still many who suffer due to past troubles.
That aside though, this movie was stunning visually and made by someone with skill and talent galore. Watching it brought me back to my youth watching war documentaries

Well I don't know much about anything, but I sure liked this film. In short, it was creative, humorous, simple, and heartwarming.
I could tell that the people working behind the scenes really cared about their film. They may not have been millions of dollars rich or famous as big studio directors are but they really cared about their work. You can tell every frame of this movie is seen through a lens with love and care from start to finish.
